description.compact: Class to access a subscribers resources from the create send API.

docblock.description: This class includes functions to add and remove subscribers , along with accessing statistics for a single subscriber

description.compact: The base route of the subscriber resource.

param.description: The list id to access (Ignored for create requests)
Authentication details to use for API calls.

docblock.param:
This array must take one of the following forms: If using OAuth to authenticate: array( 'access_token' => 'your access token', 'refresh_token' => 'your refresh token')
Or if using an API key: array('api_key' => 'your api key')

param.description: The protocol to use for requests (http|https)
The level of debugging required CS_REST_LOG_NONE | CS_REST_LOG_ERROR | CS_REST_LOG_WARNING | CS_REST_LOG_VERBOSE
The host to send API requests to. There is no need to change this
The logger to use. Used for dependency injection
serialiser to use. Used for dependency injection
transport to use. Used for dependency injection

description.compact: Change the list id used for calls after construction
Adds a new subscriber to the specified list

param.description: The subscriber details to use during creation.

docblock.param: This array should be of the form array ( 'EmailAddress' => The new subscribers email address 'Name' => The name of the new subscriber 'CustomFields' => array( array( 'Key' => The custom fields personalisation tag 'Value' => The value for this subscriber ) ) 'Resubscribe' => Whether we should resubscribe this subscriber if they already exist in the list 'RestartSubscriptionBasedAutoResponders' => Whether we should restart subscription based auto responders which are sent when the subscriber first subscribes to a list. )

return.description: A successful response will be empty

description.compact: Updates an existing subscriber (email, name, state, or custom fields) in the specified list.

docblock.description: The update is performed even for inactive subscribers, but will return an error in the event of the given email not existing in the list.

param.description: The email address of the susbcriber to be updated
The subscriber details to use for the update. Empty parameters will remain unchanged

docblock.param: This array should be of the form array ( 'EmailAddress' => The new email address 'Name' => The name of the subscriber 'CustomFields' => array( array( 'Key' => The custom fields personalisation tag 'Value' => The value for this subscriber 'Clear' => true/false (pass true to remove this custom field. in the case of a [multi-option, select many] field, pass an option in the 'Value' field to clear that option or leave Value blank to remove all options) ) ) 'Resubscribe' => Whether we should resubscribe this subscriber if they already exist in the list 'RestartSubscriptionBasedAutoResponders' => Whether we should restart subscription based auto responders which are sent when the subscriber first subscribes to a list. )

return.description: A successful response will be empty

description.compact: Imports an array of subscribers into the current list

param.description: An array of subscribers to import.

docblock.param: This array should be of the form array ( array ( 'EmailAddress' => The new subscribers email address 'Name' => The name of the new subscriber 'CustomFields' => array( array( 'Key' => The custom fields personalisation tag 'Value' => The value for this subscriber 'Clear' => true/false (pass true to remove this custom field. in the case of a [multi-option, select many] field, pass an option in the 'Value' field to clear that option or leave Value blank to remove all options) ) ) ) )

param.description: we should resubscribe any existing subscribers
default, subscription based auto responders do not trigger during an import. Pass a value of true to override this behaviour
default, subscription based auto responders will not be restarted

return.description: A successful response will be an object of the form

description.compact: Gets a subscriber details, including custom fields

return.description: A successful response will be an object of the form

description.compact: Gets the sending history to a specific subscriber

return.description: A successful response will be an object of the form

description.compact: Unsubscribes the given subscriber from the current list

param.description: The email address to unsubscribe

return.description: A successful response will be empty

comment.value: We need to build the subscriber data structure.

description.compact: deletes the given subscriber from the current list

param.description: The email address to delete

return.description: A successful response will be empty

description.compact: The protocol to use while accessing the api
The base route of the create send api.
The serialiser to use for serialisation and deserialisation of API request and response data
The transport to use to send API requests

var.description: or CS_REST_SocketTransport or your own custom transport.

description.compact: The logger to use for debugging of all API requests
The default options to use for each API request.

docblock.description:
These can be overridden by passing in an array as the call_options argument to a single api request. Valid options are:
deserialise boolean: Set this to false if you want to get the raw response. This can be useful if your passing json directly to javascript.
While there are clearly other options there is no need to change them.

param.description: Authentication details to use for API calls.

docblock.param:
This array must take one of the following forms: If using OAuth to authenticate: array( 'access_token' => 'your access token', 'refresh_token' => 'your refresh token')
Or if using an API key: array('api_key' => 'your api key')
Note that this method will continue to work in the deprecated case when $auth_details is passed in as a string containing an API key.

param.description: The protocol to use for requests (http|https)
The level of debugging required CS_REST_LOG_NONE | CS_REST_LOG_ERROR | CS_REST_LOG_WARNING | CS_REST_LOG_VERBOSE
The host to send API requests to. There is no need to change this
The logger to use. Used for dependency injection
serialiser to use. Used for dependency injection
transport to use. Used for dependency injection

comment.value: If $auth_details is a string, assume it is an API key

description.compact: Refresh the current OAuth token using the current refresh token.

return.description: True if the wrapper is using SSL.

description.compact: Internal method to make a general API request based on the provided options
